name: Peter Steele
description:
'''Peter Thomas Ratajczyk''' (January 4, 1962 â€“ April 14, 2010), known professionally as '''Peter Steele''', was an American musician who was the lead vocalist, bassist, and composer of the [[gothic metal]] band [[Type O Negative]]. Before forming Type O Negative, Steele had formed the [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] band [[Fallout (band)|Fallout]] and the [[thrash metal]] band [[Carnivore (band)|Carnivore]].

As the frontman for Type O Negative, Steele was known for his [[Vampire|vampiric]] appearance, {{height|ft=6|in=8}} stature, rich [[bass (voice type)|bass]] vocals, and a dark, often [[Self-deprecation|self-deprecating]] sense of humor. His lyrics have been described as "often intensely personal, dealing with subjects including love, loss and addiction." Steele credited [[Black Sabbath]] and [[the Beatles]] as his key musical influences. He has been listed among the "66 Best Hard Rock and Metal Frontmen of All Time" by ''[[Loudwire]]''.
